**Result 9:**
Channel: #autopilot-design-system-core-team
User: @shelley.dignum
Time: 2025-05-22T21:32:07.496059+00:00
Relevance: 0.40
Message: Channel: autopilot-design-system-core-team
User: shelley.dignum
Time: 2025-05-22 21:32:07
Thread Reply
Message: @Hadley Robin @Andrei Clodius My status report:
• *Prompt box* 
    ◦ Variable picker
        ▪︎ Need some confirmation on the focus state for the <https://uipath-product.slack.com/archives/C08N52A17HP/p1747942538884149|variable picker> before I can close it out. 
        ▪︎ Added the back arrow button to the scoped variant list header
    ◦ Context tags - refactored to be usable without a hover state for the Message component.
    ◦ Updated the add menu button corner radius. Andrei will show Liz the zoomed out version and see if we really need to adjust the spacing (may just need to add a min width)
    ◦ Should we wait to *publish* all the AI chat stuff at once? Or do you think I should publish the prompt box, context tags, and variable picker once the above items are solidified?
    ◦ I still need to review the guidelines. Will review tomorrow.
• *Messages* 
    ◦ I believe the `Human response` is done. :white_check_mark: 
    ◦ The general AI chat message is done (Andrei did an awesome job making clear what was final and the views we need - I just made some spacing adjustments, simplified the properties, and updated the components to be pointing to the one in the file instead of the sandbox file.
    ◦ Tomorrow (Friday) I will take a closer look at the Tool View
• After messages is done, we have the `chat header` and the `chat history` to go through. Because I'm needing to be more focused on the Onboarding experience project, I'm wondering if @Andrei Clodius feels good about taking those final items on since he now has editor access to the Apollo components library and has seen some of how we're doing the components for the design system. 
Reactions: :star: (1) by andrei.clodius, :redbullparrot: (1) by andrei.clodius, :catshake: (1) by andrei.clodius, :fire: (1) by andrei.clodius
---

raw_result.results:
Found 10 messages matching 'a comprehensive summary of the subjects discussed in the #autopilot-one-engineering group':

**Result 1:**
Channel: #autopilot-one-engineering
User: @zach.eslami
Time: 2025-06-06T22:49:27.381489+00:00
Relevance: 0.62
Message: Channel: autopilot-one-engineering
User: zach.eslami
Time: 2025-06-06 22:49:27
Thread Reply
Message: Hey @Alvin Stanescu @Silviu Tanasie we had a few questions we wanted to run by you to get your take about Autopilot :one: initiative. We were discussing on our autopilot for agents pow-wow some potential challenges that could exist to the e2e UX (beyond unifying to common design patterns) with a common chassis (vs. more specialized + segregated autopilots). @Tomasz Religa has some war stories from his time at Microsoft and what was attempted with Copilot in the Office suite he'd be happy to share

Let us know what you think!
<https://uipath.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/Agents/pages/89115427078/Autopilot+One+Thoughts+and+Questions>
---
**Result 2:**
Channel: #autopilot-design-system-core-team
User: @andrei.clodius
Time: 2025-05-13T07:28:29.841159+00:00
Relevance: 0.59
Message: Channel: autopilot-design-system-core-team
User: andrei.clodius
Time: 2025-05-13 07:28:29
Message: @Connor Rowland @Hadley Robin it would be great if we can work in parallel as we'll need a list of every type of Autopilot feature that any of the product teams currently have on their roadmap and how it's expressed.
Ideally in a google sheet with title+screenshot (if available) + description (what it does).

@jeffin.philip has done an audit on some of this stuff as it exists in the platform in the little time he had, but we need a more detailed scope as it's not clear what those features actually do.

• For example: some inline buttons seem to open up suggestions & show a magic wand, but they just open up the autopilot side panel. some are related to AP-powered search, but it's not AP it's just a simple RAG that has little to do with our AP experience.
---
**Result 3:**

Message: *Autopilot for Developers in Unified Build Weekly 5/20*

*Summary:*
• Presented new Autopilot Framework features for model and operating mode selection @Alvin Stanescu
• PO: Finished PoC of integration with Autopilot Framework, work in progress to productize this @Andrii Palyha (Андрій Палига) 
• Agents: Not yet started on integration PoC, currently blocked with telemetry fixes and synchronization between Health Score and Agent Generation @Zach Eslami @Justin LeClair
*Follow-ups:*
• Coded Apps: Not yet started on integration PoC, status unclear. @Udit Chandna to update this thread.

Message: guys, can we please get to a consolidated plan when we have the unified autopilot for developers across the experiences (API WFs, Agents, Maestro, Apps, Data Fabric, Connector Builder, RPA WFs, etc). @Alvin Stanescu @Silviu Tanasie can prepare a timeline for the core work of the A4D framework, but we need all other teams to work with the A4D team to get the joint work prioritized.

**Result 9:**
Channel: #autopilot-design-patterns
User: @connor.rowland
Time: 2025-03-21T20:52:37.850989+00:00
Relevance: 0.57
Message: Channel: autopilot-design-patterns
User: connor.rowland
Time: 2025-03-21 20:52:37
Message: *Autopilot, Generalized Use Cases*
@Haidy Perez-Francis, @Hadley Robin and I looked through the original list of Autopilot V1 use cases with the goal of abstracting those that apply globally (meaning they're not specific to OR, Studio, or Test Manager instances of Autopilot, which have more functionality).

<https://uipath.atlassian.net/wiki/x/YAAgshQ|You can find those here. >Please let us know if you have any feedback.

We intend to build on this document to add visual references of the _product-specific use cases_ (anything that isn't global) to give more clarity to FPS teams looking to do the same as OR/Studio/TM.
Reactions: :+1::skin-tone-2: (1) by andrei.clodius

Message: *Autopilot, Generalized Use Cases*
@Haidy Perez-Francis, @Hadley Robin and I looked through the original list of Autopilot V1 use cases with the goal of abstracting those that apply globally (meaning they're not specific to OR, Studio, or Test Manager instances of Autopilot, which have more functionality).

<https://uipath.atlassian.net/wiki/x/YAAgshQ|You can find those here. >Please let us know if you have any feedback.

We intend to build on this document to add visual references of the _product-specific use cases_ (anything that isn't global) to give more clarity to FPS teams looking to do the same as OR/Studio/TM.
Reactions: :+1::skin-tone-2: (1) by andrei.clodius
